title: Table 2 to Schedule 3 to, the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 10) (Assessment of Means) 
Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024. 

Commencement

title: Table 2 to Schedule 3 to, the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 August 2024.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 August 2024. 

Definitions

text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations, “Regulations of 2024” means the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 3) (Income 
Disregard) Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 140 of 2024). 

Assessment of Means

title: Table 2 to Schedule 3 to, the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the
heading: 4. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
4. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 

Regulations 2007 are amended — 

(a) 

in article 8(3), (amended by article 3(a) of the Regulations of 
2024) by the insertion of the following paragraphs after paragraph 
(dd): 

“(de) an amount up to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by the Department of Further and Higher 
Innovation and Science’s Student 
Education, Research, 
Accommodation Assistance Fund, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th September, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [433] 3 

(df) an amount up to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by Co-operative Housing Ireland’s Scholarship 
Programme,”, 

(b) 

in article 155, (amended by article 3(b) of the Regulations of 
2024) by the insertion of the following paragraphs after paragraph 
(dac): 

“(dad) an amount up to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by the Department of Further and Higher 
Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science’s Student 
Accommodation Assistance Fund, 

(dae) an amount up to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by Co-operative Housing Ireland’s Scholarship 
Programme,”, 

and 

(c) 

in article 174, (amended by article 9 of the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 
8) (Child Maintenance and Liable Relatives) Regulations 2024 
(S.I. No. 262 of 2024)) by the insertion of the following 
paragraphs after paragraph (id): 

“(ie) an amount up to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by the Department of Further and Higher 
Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science’s Student 
Accommodation Assistance Fund, 

(if) an amount up to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by Co-operative Housing Ireland’s Scholarship 
Programme,”. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [433] 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 August, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 August, 2024. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [433] 5

title: Table 2 to Schedule 3 to, the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide that scholarship payments to a maximum of €7000.00 
per annum paid by either by the Department of Further and Higher Education, 
Research, Innovation and Science’s Student Accommodation Assistance Fund 
or Co-operative Housing Ireland’s Scholarship Programme to a person will be 
disregarded in the means test for social assistance payments, increases for 
qualified adults and the Working Family Payment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [433]
